dialogues.text: Do you suppose it has anything to do  with Lila's unusually hairy body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) No, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it seems that since Lila  broached the subject of children,  you've been on edge and I know you  have an issue with the, uh, body  hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (revelation) Oh, I see. Yes, that's something to  think about. That's very good. That's  what you get the big bucks, right?  Ha ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just think it might be important  to explore your feelings for Lila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love Lila. I mean, she's a wonderful  person. And... she loves me! That's  no small potatoes. I mean she really  loves me. She's sacrificed so much  to be in this relationship with me.  And she's a good person. A truly  good person. How rare is that in  this world, eh? And how could I stop  loving somebody because of a little  physical imperfection, if it can  even be called that. I mean, God  knows I'm not perfect! What about my  eyesight? It's lousy, that's what!  Lila's not going to leave me because  of my eyesight. What about my penis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how do you feel about Gabrielle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan puts his head in his hands and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan is holding flash cards up to Puff. Puff tentativel reads aloud from the cards. Gabrielle sits nearby on a st fish-netted legs crossed, arms crossed, and an angry  expression on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-eve-n-ing-lay-dees-and-gent- elmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravo, Puff! Bravo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff smiles happily. Nathan and Puff both look over at  Gabrielle for her approval. None is forthcoming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't Puff doing spectacularly, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmmph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabby, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmph. Hmmph. (beat) Nathan, we have to talk, you and I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in front of the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabrielle stands, turns, and stomps across the room. Nath follows her angry, switching hips with his eyes, as does  Puff. She exits into the hall. Nathan looks at Puff and  shrugs. Puff returns the shrug. Nathan follows Gabrielle  into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabrielle stands there waiting, a troubled look on her fa her eyes brimming. Nathan emerges, tries to embrace her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My little French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing him away) Stop. Get away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to choose Nathan. It's like  Sophie's choice. Only it is Nathan's  choice. Did you ever see that movie,  Sophie's Choice? It is like that.  Only it is this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabby, you know I'm trying to sort  things out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hard) No! It is now that you must decide. (soft) I love you, Doctor Nathan... (hard) ...but I will not wait. I will not  be your chippy. I will not be your  little Mademoiselle Parlez-vous side  dish. (soft) My love. I want to have a sweet tiny  baby inside my belly... from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan gets a faraway look in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan and Gabrielle sit on a blanket on this otherwise e beach. There is a light breeze. Gabrielle has one of her  breasts exposed and is nursing an infant. Nathan looks at the baby's face. It is angelic. He looks up and smiles at Gabrielle. She smiles back. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan snaps out of his reverie, looks pleadingly at the  waiting Gabrielle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you so much, Gabrielle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But?... But? There is a "but," Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't know how to leave Lila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabrielle tears off her lab coat. Underneath she is weari practically nothing, a skimpy black dress. She throws the lab coat at Nathan, turns and storms down the hall. Natha watches until she disappears around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Now there's a butt, Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brings the lab coat up to his face and breathes in her fragrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila, all prettied up and civilized and manicured, is set the table for dinner. She is humming. Nathan walks in the door. Lila doesn't hear him. He stands in the doorway for moment, watching Lila from behind. His face is blank. Lil catches sight of him. She's startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! (laughs) I didn't see you there, sneaky boy! (runs over and kisses  him) You're like a boy sneaking in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (so bored) ...the back door of a movie theater.  Yes, indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember that from my book? I'm  touched! (kisses him again) What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Hard day. Gonna have a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make it. (beats him to the  portable bar) I'm so happy, Nathan! Everything's  going to be so great! Scotch on the  rocks, right? (giggles) Just kidding. I know what you drink,  mister. I know what you drink. (pours and blends and  shakes, etc.) Voila!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila hands Nathan a frothy pink concoction with a pineapp wedge sticking out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan stares contemplatively out the window and sips his drink. Lila watches him, comes up behind him, puts her ar around him. Nathan cringes, but tries to cover it. Lila f the cringe, but pretends not to have. She keeps her arms  around him for a moment longer, then casually removes the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fishing) How's work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cruddy, okay? Are you satisfied?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pouty) No. I don't want your work to be  cruddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My assistant quit today. Okay? He  was highly valuable to the project.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, baby. I'm sorry. Can't you hire  somebody else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila screws up her face in concentration, trying to come  with a viable solution to Nathan's problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! I could come work for you! I  know I haven't been all that  supportive of this project, but I've  come around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, baby! I think that this is a  wonderful project you're doing, taking  this poor unfortunate, uncivilized  creature and turning him into a human  being! What a wonderful wonderful  compassionate man you are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! And I want to help. You won't  have to pay me, and I was thinking  of giving up that crazy nature writing  anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who needs it? I have you and I have  being a woman and I have thinking  about womanly things! I love being a  woman because...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such as what womanly things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such as my man and how to please  him! (kisses him) Such as making wonderful dinners for  my man! (kisses him again,  leads him to the  table, sits him down) Such as looking pretty for my man! (kisses him again) And I'm writing an article on quilting  for the Ladies Home Journal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had sold my fucking soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I let her sell her soul. I stood by  as she did it. It's inexcusable. (beat) At the time though I thought it might  help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she came to work with Nathan,  she seemed different, gentlemen, I  don't know, somehow soulless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff is in his case in formal evening wear in a makeshift opera box. There is a mannequin woman sitting next to him and a boom box pumping out Beethoven's Fidelio. Puff seem attentive, refined, occasionally bringing a pair of opera glasses up to his eyes, pinky extended. Outside the case, Nathan and Lila look on. The opera is over. Puff stands,  applauds, yells "Bravo", and tosses a rose in the directi of the imaginary stage. The rose hits the Lucite wall and falls to the floor. Nathan and Lila stand and applaud Puf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravo to you, Puff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was wonderful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff smiles and performs a foppish bow, almost a curtsy. picks up the rose, sniffs it, dramatically savoring its s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan and Gabrielle are having sex. They are focused and intent, although Gabrielle keeps chatting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were wonderful today, darling.  Such authority with the ape-man boy.  It made me so hot for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unnhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way you are taming him, it sends  chills down my girlish spine and...  everywhere else, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Urgh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take me, darling! Tame your little  monkey of love!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a mutual climax. A moment of silence, then a spe Nathan rolls off onto his side of the bed. We see that it really Lila in bed with him, not Gabrielle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighing) Well, I'm tamed, Dr. Bronfman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan stares up at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad... my assistant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a montage of interactions between Nathan, Puff, an Lila. 1) Nathan demonstrates the proper way to taste wine: snif the cork, swishing the wine around in the glass, sipping, nodding in the affirmative to the waiter. Puff, inside hi case, imitates it perfectly. 2) Nathan shows Puff a flashcard which reads: "I'll start tonight with the foie gras." 3) Puff is holding up a small hand mirror and trimming no hairs. Lila applauds. 4) Puff juggles three balls while riding a unicycle. 5) Puff, dressed as Peter Pan, stands with legs spread an hands on hips. He is singing "I Gotta Crow." 6) Puff, dressed in an apron and chef's hat, is tossing a salad. There are two types of vinegar to choose from. He  hesitates, then chooses the balsamic. Nathan and Lila app 7) Puff, in a smoking jacket and smoking a pipe, is sitti in an easy chair, next to a fake fire and a fake sleeping dog, and reading a book of poems by Yeats. Lila and Natha outside the case, applaud and embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping up) Oh boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Puff, we're leaving on the  electronic collar. I don't think  we'll need to shock you, but just in  case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. That's fair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan unlocks the case. Puff tentatively steps out into world. He hugs Nathan. It's a grateful, obsequious, sligh pathetic hug. Nathan hugs him back, but he's keeping him a distance. Puff pulls himself out of the hug, but still  rests his hands on Nathan's shoulders and looks him in th eye, almost like a lover. Then he parts with Nathan and g over to embrace Lila. She graciously receives him. After moment in the embrace, Puff starts dry-humping Lila. Lila can't get out of his clutches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Puff! Bad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan presses a button, which shocks Puff and sends him  flying. Puff appears disoriented, then gets up off the fl brushes himself off, and turns to Lila with a bow of his  head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My apologies, madam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Puff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shan't happen again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila, Nathan, and Puff walk along. Puff is astounded by  everything he sees. He looks with wonderment at the tall  buildings, the cars, the many different types of people. looks like an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff, Lila, and Nathan are eating lunch. Everything is ve proper. Puff is doing wonderfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is great, Puff. You're doing  fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm loving this. It's such a treat  to be out and about. What a wonderful  invention a city is. The immense  buildings of glass and steel glinting  in the afternoon sun, the smartly  dressed women in their best summer  frocks, the colorful street vendors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waitress comes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just spectacular. Great salmon.  Fantastico! You've got to give me  the recipe! My compliments to the  chef!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff stands and grabs her and starts humping her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan presses a button on a small black box. Puff falls the floor. The waitress looks on, sort of confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And will that be all today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila, Nathan, and Puff are in the back seat of the moving taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It shan't happen again. I swear it.  I'm just getting my sea legs, you  know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patting Puff on the  back) It's an animal urge, Puff. It's  nothing to be ashamed of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila! Tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila looks at Nathan, amends her statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Puff) You just have to control it. We're  not apes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you very much for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff is sitting in a chair and facing a screen. The colla is around his neck. Nathan and Lila stand behind him at a slide projector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think this aversion therapy  is really necessary, doctor. I  understand the problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Humor me, Puff. It's essential that  I am able to trust you to function  independently in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bow to your expertise in these  matters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila dims the lights and switches on the projector. An im of a pretty, fully clothed woman appears on the screen. P eyes widen, but he remains seated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. You're doing fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The slide changes to a naked woman standing in a neutral  position, no expression on her face. Puff twitches, but s seated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The slide changes to another photo of the same woman in t same position, but with a seductive smile on her face. Pu clutches the arms of the chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing very nicely, Puff. I'm  pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The slide changes to another picture of the same woman, t time she is naked, has her back to the camera, is stickin her butt out, and looking over her shoulder at the viewer with shiny, heavily lipsticked, pursed lips. Puff is shak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff leaps out of his chair screaming and lunges for the  screen. Nathan grabs the black box and jolts him. Puff go flying in the air and lands with a crack. He heaves for a while, then leaps up and runs for the screen again. Again Nathan shocks him. Again he lands on the floor. He  heaves, stands, lunges for the screen again. Nathan shock him. This happens seven more times. Smoke is pouring out  from the collar. Puff struggles to his feet. Looks at the screen. He shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unimpressed) Eh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff sits down in his chair, and studies his finger nails Nathan switches off the projector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent work, Puff. Extra desert  tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yahoo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow, the acid test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a Hooters-type establishment called "Chester's." The waitresses are very busty and in Tight t-shirts which are emblazoned with the name of the restaurant. Lila, Nat and Puff sit at a table. Puff studies his menu intently, daring to look up. Lila looks around uncomfortably. A wai approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you all doin' today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerily) Very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awkwardly) Very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking down) Very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good enough! What can I get for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff, why don't you order first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at menu) Uh, what's a Reuben, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waitress leans over to study the menu. Her breasts ar in Puff's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The what, honey? Oh, the Reuben?  That's a sandwich with corned beef  and sauer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine. That's what I'll have.  Corned beef is a good food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila, Nathan, and Puff walk along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff, I'm proud of you! You did  remarkably well under difficult  circumstances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff jumps up and down excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I? I tried so hard! I really  concentrated! Oh, I'm so happy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And because you did so well, we have  a little surprise for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happily) Extra dessert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila, Nathan, and Puff enter. Puff sees his Lucite case. It has been transformed into a bachelor pad. Inside is a  king-size bed, a TV, a couch, coffee table, shelves lined with books, a small kitchenette. There is a curtain which can be drawn for privacy. Puff is taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprise!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff gasps and runs into the room. He is thrilled. Nathan holds up a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Free to come and go as you please.  There's some "mad money" in the night  table drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking the key,  hugging Nathan) It's wonderful! Do you think I'm  ready? Do you really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust that you'll make good, mature  decisions. I trust that you'll do  the proper thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I will! (gravely) Your very trust has instilled an  enormous sense of responsibility in  me. I don't want to disappoint you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Remember, when in doubt: Don't  ever do what you really want to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking it in) Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila and Nathan sit as far as possible from each other an read books. Nathan looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff, dressed identically to Nathan, reads Moby Dick and  smokes a pipe. He distractedly taps his foot, stands and  studies a Monet print on the wall. His foot is still nerv tapping. He checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to go down and check on  Puff. See how he's holding up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stretching) Should I come with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. You just relax. How's the book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lazily, happily) Ummm. It's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan kisses Lila on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't be long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan drives with a determined look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apartment is a mess. Every single light is on. Gabrielle is lounging in a stained nightshirt with a dope cartoon bear on the front. She's got some sort of pimple  medication dabbed on her face. She unconsciously but  ferociously bites her nails as she watches TV and talks o the phone. There is no trace of a French accent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) You're kidding! Holy shit. (beat) Yeah, no duh! I had a wild hair up  my ass over that for a month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a knock at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. It's Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabrielle's eyes widen. She jumps up from the couch and s straightening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Call you back. (hangs up, assumes  French accent) You bastard! What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ripping off her  nightshirt) We have nothing to say! You are a  rotten bastard, that's what!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan stands there leaning against the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Just one minute of your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? You've made your decision, Mister  Stinky American! Now I hate you! No,  I don't hate you; I don't even think  about you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got some things to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabrielle is standing in front of a mirror, holding diffe sexy outfits up to herself, trying to decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think it would be easier if  I could talk to you in person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear banging and rustling and arranging coming from in the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think too much. I need a man who  doesn't think so much but acts more  than he thinks... is what I need!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me! You make me sick when  you pretend to not understand what I  am saying to you! Go away from here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning away) Well, look, I'm sorry to have bothered  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to head down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, then screaming) All right, already! Come in if you  must! The door's open, you son of a  bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan heads back to the apartment, tries the knob. The d open. He enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are low. The place is neat. Cool jazz plays qu in the background. Candles are lit. Gabrielle is nowhere be found. Nathan takes it all in. It's quite seductive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here, you lousy piece of merde.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan follows her voice. He exits into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candles in here also. Gabrielle, now made up and in a sat teddy, lounges in bed, eating cherries from a bowl. Natha just stares. She is slightly out of breath, but trying to conceal it. A film of perspiration glistens on her brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (testy) Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, you're beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I look a mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You look so beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway. Come already to the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... I'm going to leave Lila. I  can't stop thinking about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've moved on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been seeing Johannsen in  chemistry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raging) That goddamn Neanderthal? I'm the  one who gave him the idea for the  combination bug spray-sun screen!  Did you know that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calm, dismissive) That's not how he tells it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not, that Swedish thief!  He's a thief of hearts! (beat) I love you, Gabrielle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismissive) Hunh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me some time to let Lila  down easily. She's a really nice  girl and I don't want to hurt her  more than is necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) You hurt me, you know, when you made  Nathan's Choice. Does that not even  matter to you, you pig?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabrielle cries quietly. Nathan moves closer to her. He  strokes her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you ever forgive me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabrielle looks up at him. Her expression is noncommittal and pouty, but she grabs his arm and pulls him down on to of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff, dressed a bit like he's a Victorian dandy, sits in front row and watches a naked woman on stage dancing. A  topless cocktail waitress comes by with a fresh drink for him. She takes away his empty glass. He is horribly drunk and holding himself with exaggerated rigidity -- an amate drinker's attempt to look sober.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan enters. Lila sits on the couch still reading. She  looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan kisses her on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were gone a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sits down next to  her) Yeah. Puff and I got into a big,  philosophical discussion. He's really  quite well read, considering he's  only been literate for a month now.  He's going to make us famous, Lila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he's doing okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seemed fine. Quiet evening enjoying  his new digs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's funny because, you know, I  just went and picked him up at some  flophouse on the lower eastside. dialogues.text: Lila smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was paradise. (beat, sadly) At least for a tiny little while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila and Puff lie naked in a tree, lazily soaking up the  midday sun. There is a rustling in the bushes. They both  look up, alert but calm. Nathan, immaculate in his safari suit, appears in the clearing. He holds a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aha! Finally. I've covered almost  the entire seaboard and parts of  eastern Ohio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugnh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugnh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh please, is that as articulate as  you can be after all the time I spent  teaching you? We've discussed  Wittgenstein, for Christ's sake. Not  that you ever had anything very  original or challenging to say on  the subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down from the tree. Both of you.  Keep your hands where I can see them.  Don't want you pulling any weapons  out of your fur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan laughs heartily, haughtily, at his joke as Lila an Puff climb down from the tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you two. You both disgust  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oook. Oook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! (to Puff) I gave you... life. I created you in  my image, Puff. I took you from this  primordial ooze and brought you into  the world of culture and art and  manners. And this is how you repay  me? By heading back to the ooze first  chance you get? I should leave you  here with Lila the ape woman. It  would serve you right, you ungrateful  piece of crap. But I'm not going to.  You're too valuable to me. Totally  selfish of me. You serve my purpose.  But if you had any smarts you would  realize that I serve your purpose as  well. Life is so much more delightful  when lived in a silk suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Lila. You can stay. I  don't have any interest in you  anymore. (to Puff) C'mon, monkey boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff looks at Lila. Lila shrugs helplessly. Puff reaches to touch her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff looks at Lila again. She jerks her head in the direc of Nathan. Puff sighs and moves to Nathan. Nathan prods Puff, and they head off through the trees. Suddenly Puff elbows Nathan. Nathan grunts, doubles over. Puff turns, lunges, and the two wrestle on the ground. Puff pries the gun from Nathan's hand, and jumps up. Nath stands also, backing away. Puff has the gun trained on Na Lila runs to Puff, stands behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff, put the gun down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ounpoo. Ungh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's be reasonable human beings  here. We're all reasonable human  beings, aren't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping up and down  like a chimp) Unka unka unka unka unka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, why don't you and Lila stay  here and have your natural life.  I'll just go on my way. You'll never  see me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lila, guiltily) I have to talk. Is that okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nathan) You did create me in your image,  Nathan. Before you I was a simple,  happy, complete being, in harmony  with the world around me. After you  I became duplicitous, cynical, angry,  anal, totally out of touch with my  surroundings. In a word, Nathan, I  became you. Lila has reintroduced me  to myself. And, incidentally, what  I'm about to do, kill you, is  something that would never have  occurred to me to do as a creature  of the Earth. Before when I killed,  it was for food or in self-defense.  Now I will kill for revenge. Revenge  is an abstract concept, Nathan. And  I learned abstract thinking from  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff, don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff shoots. A crow screams. The fluttering of wings. The bullet hits Nathan in the head. He falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila sobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I shot Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff dabs his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Lila shot Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Puff shot me. Then I died. That's  all I know. That's the end of my  story. Do I get to go to heaven now? (beat) Or is it... hell? (beat) Or... what? (beat) I just stay here, is it? I just stay  here and tell it again? And after  that? Again? And after... (sighs) Yes. Yes, of course. (sighs, clears his  throat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move into an extreme close-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beginning again) I don't even know what sorry means  anymore. It's odd. When I was alive  I knew -- maybe it was all I knew...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila runs to Nathan. She kneels beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) We bury the body. We disappear into  the woods. Nobody knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, then quietly) No. This is the end of the road.  There's a dead human being here. For  all of his faults, he was a human  being, and certainly a victim of his  culture as much as anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget him, Lila. We'll disappear.  We'll never talk about it again.  We'll never talk again period. I  love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff, what happened to you is as  much my fault as Nathan's. Maybe  more so, because I knew it was wrong  and I went along with it anyway. I'm  taking responsibility for the murder.  I want you to go back to your old  life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't let you do that. I shot the  bastard. And I'm glad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Go back to the woods. This is a  sacrifice I need to make. In my world  we have something called penance.  It's another abstraction, but I had  the concept drummed into my head  during my years in the convent. It  doesn't exist for you, and it  shouldn't. See, I could never be  free again anyway, so I might as  well be in jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Then I'll live for both of us, Lila.  I'll be the most free, truest animal  in the whole forest. For both of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tearing up) That's what I'm counting on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an idea) But first I'll live among them, just  long enough to testify before congress  about the waywardness of humankind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Okay. If you think it will help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lila, now in prison coveralls, sits in a dayroom with oth women convicts. She is watching a TV mounted on the wall. Puff is testifying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so, gentlemen, that is my story.  I agreed to testify before this  committee because I hoped to convey  to the American public that there is  indeed a paradise lost. Human beings  have become so enamored of their  technologies and their intellectual  prowess and their fancy gourmet foods,  that they've forgotten to look to  the Earth as a teacher. This is  hubris, my friends. And my story of  destruction and betrayal is proof of  that. I will keep my promise to Lila.  I will shed this suit and go back  into the wilderness. I will live out  my days naked and free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. Your story has touched  us all deeply. We will pass some  legislation addressing this problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. That is all I ask. (to camera) Good-bye, Lila. I take you with me  in my untamed heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff stands and exits the auditorium. Flashbulbs flash. In the prison common room, Lila wipes a tear from her eye She seems genuinely happy. She looks out a small barred w and sees a bluebird light there, then fly away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff walks along, a man on a mission. As he walks he shed articles of clothing. He is followed by reporters and  cameramen and celebrity hounds. Soon he is naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff walks along, naked. People cheer from porches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff walks along. He is still followed by reporters. Cows watch the parade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff walks along a dirt road. He is about to disappear in the forest. An older woman rushes out from the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you on C-Span. I've been looking  for you for thirty years. Then there  you were, such a beautiful, beautiful  grown man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The older woman starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... Derek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff holds out his hand for her to shake. Flashbulbs flas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (formally) It's a pleasure to meet you, mother.  But I'm an ape like dad was... (checks watch) And I have to go back into the woods  now... forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resigned) Yes, I suppose so. I suppose I knew  that was going to be what you would  say. It's good to see you again  though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in the book, if you ever want to  drop me a line or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an ape, mom. I'm an ape. And  apes don't drop lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His mother weeps. Puff gently rests his hand on her shoul for a moment, then he turns and waves to the reporters. T crowd bursts into applause. Flashbulbs flash. Puff jogs i the woods. There is a collective sigh, and then everyone  turns and heads back in the direction from which they cam We hold on the woods for a moment. A car pulls up. Puff  hurries out of the woods and jumps in the passenger side the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puff leans over and kisses Gabrielle, who is driving the  car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, my little boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, ma. Did you bring any clothes?  I'm freezing my ass off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oui. Nathan's silk suit, just like  you asked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. (putting on suit) God, I've wanted you forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabrielle giggles. Puff kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabrielle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes glistening) You remind me so much of Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like father, like son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stroking his face) You remind me so much of Nathan plus  so much of my little mongrel doggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This turns Gabrielle on. She kisses him passionately. Whe the kiss runs its course, Puff speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabrielle kisses him again, even more passionately this t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As much as I loved Nathan, I'm not  sorry she killed him, if it means I  can have you. Is that a terrible  thing to say, my sweet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting her finger  to his lips) Hush. No, it is never terrible to be  in love. Nathan's memory lives on in  our sacred union. (beat) I'm not sorry she killed him either.  Nathan was wonderful. He was erudite  and sophisticated and charming. You  are all that, too. But you have  something more. You have a bit of  the animal in you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smile flirtatiously at each other. Puff leans over a kisses Gabrielle's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go eat, I'm starved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: French?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oui.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car makes a screeching u-turn. It disappears in the  direction of the city. When the dust clears, we see the t white mice standing there on the side of the road, shiver and emaciated. The male holds out his the thumb and the f holds a tiny little sign which reads: New York. There is a look of hopelessness in their beady black eyes FADE OUT.
